about_section_title: 25+ Years of Experience in Real Estate
about_section_desc: Real Estate Group specializes in the sale of single-family homes, maisonettes, rental rooms, hotels, villas, and commercial spaces, in collaboration with experienced architects, civil engineers, and the best local craftsmen. Our twenty years of experience in buying and selling our own and others' properties offer our clients the ideal guarantee of quality services. We undertake the sale of your property or the construction of your home with consistency, speed, and, above all, reliability! Our team includes experienced architects and civil engineers, as well as the best local craftsmen active in the area. Our company is housed in a privately owned building in Nea Vrasna. The buying and selling process is conducted with complete confidentiality, in collaboration with local surveyors and a lawyer who speaks Greek, English, and Bulgarian. His goal is for clients from abroad to be legally informed and confident about their purchase before the contract is signed. Our aim is the correct and swift completion of the transaction process, with our client's satisfaction as our primary concern.
faq1_question: What is the process for buying a property?
faq1_answer: The process begins with finding the right property, followed by legal and technical checks, signing the preliminary agreement, and finally signing the final contract at the notary's office.
faq2_question: What documents are needed for a sale?
faq2_answer: For a sale, you need title deeds, tax clearance, an energy performance certificate, an engineer's certificate of legality, and other documents depending on the case.
faq3_answer: Yes, we provide comprehensive management services for short-term rental properties, from promotion and bookings to cleaning and maintenance.
faq_intro_text: Buying a property is a big decision. We understand you have questions, so we've gathered clear, honest answers to help you understand the process and make informed decisions every step of the way.
faq4_question: Is a lawyer mandatory for real estate transactions?
faq4_answer: No, since 2014, a lawyer is not mandatory for signing a contract. However, legal advice is strongly recommended to protect your interests.
faq5_question: What kind of permit is required for construction or renovation?
faq5_answer: For construction, a building permit is required. For renovation, depending on the extent of the work, a small-scale permit, work approval, or a full building permit may be needed.
faq6_question: What is the Building ID (Taftotita Ktiriou)?
faq6_answer: The Building ID is an electronic file containing all of a building's details (permits, plans, legality). It is mandatory for every property transfer.
faq7_question: Do I need to declare a renovation to the authorities?
faq7_answer: Yes, most renovation work requires some form of declaration or permit from the relevant municipality or planning office, depending on the scale and type of work.
faq8_question: What about illegal constructions or modifications?
faq8_answer: Illegal constructions must be legalized or demolished. There are various legalization procedures involving payment of fines, depending on the date and nature of the illegality.
faq9_question: Documents for Selling or Constructing a Property
faq9_answer: For a sale, you need titles, tax clearance, ENFIA (property tax) certificate, energy certificate, and an engineer's certificate. For construction, you need a topographic plan, architectural plans, structural study, etc.
faq10_answer: Masonry buildings are traditional constructions with load-bearing walls. Prefabricated buildings are manufactured off-site and assembled on-location, offering speed and economy.
faq11_answer: Real estate agencies handle finding, promoting, and negotiating properties, providing specialized services to buyers and sellers.
